no.tornado.brap.client
Class ServiceProxyFactory

java.lang.Object
  no.tornado.brap.client.ServiceProxyFactory

public class ServiceProxyFactory
extends Object

Factory that creates service proxies for the client. Simply supply the interface class you want to access, and the URL to the exposed service and cast the result to your interface class.

Accessing a remote service is as easy as:

 MyService myService = (MyService) ServiceProxyFactory.
      createProxy(MyService.class, "http://example.com/MyService");

You can also supply an optional credentials argument.

 MyService myService = (MyService) ServiceProxyFactory.
      createProxy(MyService.class, "http://example.com/MyService", user);

Method Detail

createProxy

public static <T> T createProxy(Class<? extends T> serviceInterface,
                                org.apache.http.client.HttpClient client,
                                String serviceURI)
Creates a proxy for the supplied serviceInterface class on the supplied URI.

Parameters:
serviceInterface - The service inteface to implement
serviceURI - A fully qualified URI to the remote service
Returns:
A service proxy that implements the given serviceInterface

createProxy

public static <T> T createProxy(Class<? extends T> serviceInterface,
                                org.apache.http.client.HttpClient client,
                                String serviceURI,
                                Serializable credentials)
Creates a proxy for the supplied serviceInterface class on the supplied URI with the supplied credentials

Parameters:
serviceInterface - The service inteface to implement
serviceURI - A fully qualified URI to the remote service
credentials - The credentials to use for authentication
Returns:
A service proxy that implements the given serviceInterface

createProxy

public static <T> T createProxy(Class<? extends T> serviceInterface,
                                MethodInvocationHandler methodInvocationHandler)
Creates a service proxy for the supplied serviceInterface taking an instantiated MethodInvocationHandler or a subclass. Clients are intended to subclass MethodInvocationHandler if you need to control the method invocation process or the credentials/url in a more spesific way.

Parameters:
serviceInterface - The service inteface to implement
methodInvocationHandler - The already instantiated MethodInvocationHandler
Returns:
A service proxy that implements the given serviceInterface

setCredentials

public static void setCredentials(Object proxy,
                                  Serializable credentials)
Set the credentials of an already created serviceproxy.

Parameters:
proxy - The serviceproxy created earlier with createProxy()
credentials - The serializable credentials object you want the proxy to include with every remote invocation.
See Also:
MethodInvocationHandler.getCredentials()

setServiceURI

public static void setServiceURI(Object proxy,
                                 String serviceURI)
Set the serviceURI for an already created serviceproxy.

Parameters:
proxy - The serviceproxy created earlier with createProxy()
serviceURI - The new serviceURI to use for subsequent method invocations
See Also:
MethodInvocationHandler.getServiceURI()
